hypothesis_content.title: Neutral Regime Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When the market is in a NEUTRAL regime (confidence > 60%) and BTC's 20-day realized volatility compresses below its 100-day rolling 25th percentile, a breakout above the 20-day Bollinger Band upper band (2 std dev) will signal the start of a BULL regime with a mean continuation of +8% over the next 10 trading days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes often represent consolidation and indecision. A severe compression in volatility within this state indicates a buildup of pent-up energy. A high-volume breakout from this compression, confirmed by a Bollinger Band breach, suggests a decisive shift in market structure from equilibrium to directional momentum, often preceding a regime change.
entry_conditions: BTC price closes above 20-day Bollinger Band upper band (2 std dev)
Volume on breakout day > 20-day average volume by 30%

exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price closes below 20-day simple moving average

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The mean 10-day return post-breakout is statistically insignificant (p > 0.1) or negative, or the breakout is followed by an immediate reversal >50% of the time, indicating a false signal or 'bear trap'.
